intro: Carex kreczetoviczii, commonly known as the Kreczetowicz sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to eastern Europe and parts of Russia, typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets that bloom in late summer. It is characterized by its clumping growth habit and is often used in wetland restoration projects. Carex kreczetoviczii plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various insects and microorganisms.
